Rodrigo record guts this is the highly

Rodrigo who made a huge break into the

license which eventually led to the
release of her debut album sour a pretty
Landmark record for the 2020s pop
landscape contributing hugely to the
commercial Renaissance pop punk is
seeing at the moment this project showed
a lot more substance than many naysayers
crying industry plant assumed it would
given Olivia's age at the time and also
her history is being a Disney Alum and
since Sauer became the success that it
was Olivia has been super strategic in
terms of when she steps into the
Limelight in fact this latest album
cycle is running almost like a more old
school rollout with a lot of carefully
planned promotion and single drops the
first track we heard from this album was
vampire which I think said a lot about
the Direction This Record was most
likely to head in the bitter lyrics the
somber pianos the hushed singing which
led to these Grand gradually escalating
piano Rock passages this thing didn't
just feel like a new song it was the
trailer to A Blockbuster teen flick
sequel with all your favorite characters
coming back and also the same director
that nailed it last time around too
which is to say this album is absolutely
positively not a departure from what
Olivia was doing on sour in fact I would
say on this LP her and producer Dan
Nigro are embracing even more those
girly rebellious pop punk Vibes that did
so well on the last record occasionally
cutting those with these sad and
romantically tragic piano ballads that
also did incredibly well on the last
record but from the cover to the
production to the song topics a lot of
what is on this album feels like a call
back to sour which makes this project
feel like an exercise in seeing just how
far Olivia and Dan can expand mature and
push these sounds and also clearly
Define them as a calling card for Olivia
I mean the first track on this thing is
literally an attempt at a self-portrait
of sorts with Olivia posing herself as
an All-American and exploring this
kind of weird yin and yang Dynamic
within herself acknowledging that yes
she is pretty and marketable in ways
that make her an American icon or a
Starlet of sorts but also she is
internally suffering fixating on dark
things and maybe a little emotionally
volatile too this contrast comes across
in the instrumental itself too with some
pretty acoustic arpeggios that kick the
song off that sound like something from
a Weezer album or two which of course
switch off on the chorus into these a
really crunchy pop punk guitar passages
which are seriously raw and that's also
the case for Olivia's vocals on this
track from the shouty forces to the hype
group screams on the bridge that sound
like a bunch of people on a roller
coaster hitting a loop but yeah this
track all around strong intro and there
are some even stronger cuts to follow
from here like bad idea right which is a

set to some talk sung vocals with Olivia
going on about how she's all up
and kind of hung up on an ex who she had

she's considering seeing him again and
the internal battle going on within this

Temptations My Brain goes foreign
there's also vampire in the first leg of

the formula of this track reads very

better singing uh more complicated
Dynamics in the lyrics more Thrills all
around I think it's a great song
Meanwhile Lacey I think is one of the
most significant moments on this record
even if it is maybe the softest but the
track does read like a sad acidic poison
slowly eating away at your insides it's
about an obsession and insecurity and
this Lacy person is the object of this
now there's not a lot of details on this
track about the dynamic between Lacey
and Olivia or how it came about but
what's clear is that it makes Olivia
feel almost like nothing almost
everything with Lacey makes her feel
inadequate in some way and in the case
of this song I think the vagueness about
it does work because it is a deeply

though ultimately at the end of the

my rotten mind and how much it worships
you following this we are thrown right
back into the pop punk trenches with
Ballad of a homeschooled girl which is

moment on the record where Olivia dives
into these feelings of social
awkwardness going as far as to
categorize these faux pas and mistakes
as social suicide there's a hefty bit of
distortion on the guitars on the vocals
they're a tad bit fried but I think it
works it's crispy and black and sort of
like a grilled cheese you left on the
pan for too long but you only burned the
one half so it's still good then making
the bed rounds out the first half of
this record with another strong and

going on in the lyrics too but things do
get a little spotty from here in the
record second half either by way of weak
production like on love is embarrassing
who's peppy pop rock guitars and drums
do lose some definition in all of the
Reverb it kind of sounds like something

like get him back who's instrumental I'm

it's weird effects it's kind of
psychedelic it's a little melty honestly
there's something about this track that

in about a hundred different ways but
she did have good times with him wishes

feeling in all of this is uh wanting to
get some kind of Revenge wanting to make

and she tells all of this to us in these

while you could read into the lyrics the

being pretty being pretty ugly honestly
the hook as well has this bright
Blissful hum to it that hits like a bit

finally the closing track Teenage Dream
finishes things off with more meta
commentary just like we got on the
opener and in a way Olivia seeks to

categorization that's been thrown onto
her and for sure it's a valid and

despite my best efforts there is

currently this album is very much not
